Given v vs. t obtain a vs. t
An object is moving along a straight line. The velocity as a function of time is shown in the figure below. The positive axis represents a vector pointing to the right.
Part a) To answer the following questions, indicate with a + or - if the acceleration vector is pointing to the right or left. Enter your answer in m/s2.
1. The object's acceleration during the time interval 0 < t < 20 is: \(a=\)
2. The object's acceleration during the time interval 20 < t < 30 is: \(a=\)
3 . The object's acceleration during the time interval 30 < t < 40 is: \(a=\)
4. The object's acceleration during the time interval 40 < t < 50 is: \(a=\)
5 . The object's acceleration during the time interval 50 < t <65 is: \(a=\)
6. The object's acceleration during the time interval 65< t < 80 is: \(a=\)
Part b) In a piece of paper do a plot of the acceleration as a function of time.
Part c) Watch the construction of the plot of a vs. t by Mr Dave Sim The Physics Café
Note: The gradient of v - t refers to the time derivative of v: \( a = \frac{dv}{dt} \) .
